title: 'Legal limits' stop Condor crew sailing their ferry
text:
Hundreds of people's travel plans have been thrown into chaos today after Condor Ferries cancelled sailings between the Channel Islands and the UK.
The Liberation had developed engine problems.
But by the time they'd been sorted, the crew had been on duty for too many hours to be legally safe to sail.
Condor has apologised and laid on an extra service tomorrow night.
We are currently experiencing issues with Condor Liberation’s engine starting system and engineers have worked hard to rectify this. Unfortunately we have now run against the legal limitations of crew hours and I regret that this means that we have to cancel today’s 8th July rescheduled service.
– Condor Ferries For the latest on sailing times, click here .
